This is expensive stuff.  So, when you can find a good price and a vendor who delivers you stick with it. I learned about Boost Oxygen, on a CO ski trip last year, and found it enormously helpful (I'm a 40-year smoker).  It's portable enough to tuck into a ski pouch, and easy to pull out up on the mountain, whenever you need to stop and catch your breath.  I've found it's nice to have around in the summer too, when I feel winded from swimming or working outside in the heat!  5 Stars! TIP: If youre traveling, have it shipped to your destination...you cant take it on an airplane!!

Im not sure what is in this can but it sure isnt 95% oxygen. A simple test will show this. Light a candle and expel the gas onto the flame. With these cans, the flame is blown out. With an actual cylinder of oxygen, it doesnt matter how fast the gas blows on the flame, the flame will become more intense with the oxygen blowing on it. Yes, I did this experiment.

Instead of trying to burn down your house to see if this is oxygen, use a pulse oximeter to see if it brings up your oxygen levels.  Used this product when I had low oxygen levels due to a sickness.  Occasionally my levels would temporarily drop into the high 80's.  Since I live in the country, by the time I'd get to the hospital, they'd be back in the low 90's and was just sent home.  I didn't like being that low, so when it would drop, I'd take a couple of shots of this, and it would get me back into the 90's in less than a minute.  It worked great for me, and gave me piece of mind by being able to bring up my oxygen levels.

The trigger to release the air seemed really stiff, not like the retail cans at all.  I examined the can closer and noticed that there was dents and dings on the can.  Then the thing that bothered me the most was the label.  On the retail can from CVS it's printed directly on the can. But if I fly to Lake Tahoe kind of area even once a year this is handy to have since I may need to climb at 10000' to 11000' levels for less than 30 minutes or so and due to having a slight COPD problem, I keep 3 of these in my plane as a precaution. I thought, since it is not an expensive item, why not ? After I bought them I wanted to try it out and I climb up to 10,000' and my pulse-oxi-meter showed my O2 level dropped from normal 97% levels to 89% after 15 minutes at that altitude and I inhaled 2 puffs of O2 from this bottle and immediately saw my meter reading jumped up to 94% another 2 puff I was at 97% level again. So in my simple test I proved myself that it worked for me. What else I needed to know? Nothing really, that was enough for me! Now, I saw some people given low star rating to this product due to they are not getting the number of puffs O2... I don't challenge their experiences but still it is a good product and I got what I expected out of it! You may too!

Just to be fair, I did some experiment, and it turns out that it is some concentration of oxygen, at least higher than air. The way I did the experiment is different from others. It is not correct to simply blow the oxygen to the flame. How I did it is I took a bottle and fill it up with this gas. Since oxygen has a higher density than air, the oxygen will sink to the bottom and replace all the air. After that, I throw a piece of ignited paper into the bottle and it burned into ashes instantly. With the contrast experiement in the air, it is much slower. This proves that the oxygen is authentic. The another reason I did the experiment was that I just can't believe they really selling fake oxygen, since extracting oxygen isn't hard, and they ain't selling it cheep either.

I caught Covid and have pre-existing asthmatic condition. My oxygen levels were falling under 90% and at times as low as in the 70s. After going to the hospital, I decided I needed to have some oxygen on standby. After receiving this order, and attempting the stairs, I needed to try this product out. To my surprise, it helped regulate my oxygen levels and restore normal breathing patterns. I would not rely on this product for life-saving purposes, but it definitely gets you through the meantime. Ive ordered Another supply to keep in house for emergency purposes. I would absolutely recommend this product as a supplement, not a replacement, for oxygen therapy.

I bought these hoping they would ease my asthmatic husband's recovery from COVID-19.  They arrived empty, unpressurized AIR - this is important.  NOT OXYGEN, air.  Useless. I tested them using a pulse oximeter. I took an initial reading - pre-O2 - as a baseline, then tried the product and took subsequent readings at measured intervals.  Tried the product again, and again took pulse oxygen readings. No change in blood O2 saturation.  Did this several times on different people with the same results.  Science, folks.... I went to return them this morning and they are NOT RETURNABLE.  I paid $10/can for a useless product that is not as advertised.  Completed wasted money.  I feel like Amazon is providing a disservice to customers by selling a scam, snake-oil product.

For people like me who have COPD and lose their breath due to damaged lungs which cannot supply the bodys demand for oxygen, Boost works extremely well. Oxygen in the air is 21% and Boost is 95%, therefore, if you cant garner enough oxygen from the atmosphere then condense the oxygen intake at four times the atmospheric oxygen with Boost and your sense of suffocation is quickly diminished. I can physically exert and take Boost, which improves my quality of life. This is one of the most important medicines I use. The FDA needs to evaluate its benefits and classify Boost as at least a Class 1 Medical Device, and have it covered by insurance.

The cold weather made my lungs weak, and I am waiting for warmer weather to run again. I took a chance on Boost, and wherever I use it, I feel instant energy and can take deep breaths. Either physically or psychologically, it is working, and I will continue to use it. Thanks Boost!
I got a whopping 4 deep inhales. Ive tried other oxygen bottles. Other are MUCH better.

3 cans included as promised. Delivers about 100 huffs per can, pressure not regulated so you lose a lot of oxygen until you learn how to work the valve. Beware that any excess that your lungs can't intake is vented and lost and the can delivers a huge amount if you just squeeze it fully. You must learn how much to squeeze so that everything that comes out goes into your lungs. Otherwise you won't get full use of the product. Bit creepy, filling your lungs from a can, but it works

Product is really lightweight, it is very hard to use it specially for elders. The push nub is really hard to push and inhale at the same time it was challenging to get it work. Dont know where to start. The can is very light. It is very easy to use. Its like a breathing mask. The oxygen.....i can't tell if i breath normal air, purified air or oxygen. Maybe its just me. Know i did store, since its a 3 pk, two in the fridge. Since im writting this, I'll try the ones in the fridge this very instant....... Well no difference. For those who reviewed this item staying it didn't work, how were you using it? I myself tried it sitting down in the car and I didn't feel anything and I felt I could have easily inhaled what the can dispenses when I press the button. While sitting or being inactive your body isn't deprived of oxygen so I them went on a 3 mile run and had it in my hand. At times I felt tired I tried inhaling but couldn't catch my breath fast enough. I then pressed the button and instead of breathing it, I let it force the oxygen into my lungs and I then exhaled. I felt very good and was able to get oxygen in faster since I couldn't get it in on my own fast enough running a 6 minute mile pace. I  was skeptical when I tried it prior to working out but while working out I could tell a big difference.

Healthy individuals get about 95 to 99 percent oxygen saturation just from breathing regular air.  Oxygen serves no purpose and won't increase your blood oxygen saturation.  Oxygen only benefits people with cardio-pulmonary issues - such as a heart attack.  And those people need continuous oxygen, not a few breaths.
These cans help me to regain my breath, and they have helped me while I quit a long-term tobacco habit.

If you are staying short of breath it can help until the ER gets to you. My brother use it when it happen to him. It help him to stay alive

So first and for most - Oxygen is non-flammable. So any review you read where individuals are trying to ignite pure oxygen are unfortunately uneducated. Please disregard their reviews. Second - Oxygen is nearly weightless, so the container you get is going to be very, very light - don't fret. I was recently diagnosed with "Cluster Headaches" - common in men after 30 years old and well through their 50s. My doc said that getting something like a Boost Oxygen container could help ease my headaches. I waited three days to go and buy one thinking taking Advil / Tylenol would be enough to help this stupid headache pass. No luck. Finally I picked one of these up this morning and took a few pulls off of it - the only reason I didn't buy off Amazon was that I didn't want to wait till next week to buy one and the manufactures website will steer you to stores that keep these in stock! Within 30 minutes to an hour, my headache is gone. Unbelievable. My only recommendation when using this is - take a deep breath, release the trigger and set it down for a for a minute and then take another pull again. Its not a race and huffing too much too fast could have an adverse effect :)

I get severe altitude issues, even for going up to 5000 ft, so I purchased this to mitigate this.  It didn't really work at all in relieving my symptoms, save for the ~5 seconds or so after each inhalation, which would require a ton of cans to sustain that usage rate.  I didn't do any testing on the oxygen content of the cans, so can't verify anything in that regard, but it did not seem very effective in my situation.  The menthol taste wasn't unpleasant and actually kind of nice.  Go figure!
I had severe Covid, after 4 months I still have a hard time taking deep breaths.  The air has helped me when I have trouble breathing.

I bought it for my mom who had breath difficulties sometimes. This one helped none at all. So small she only took few breath and it run out. I would love to return it unfortunately we used one of them

Sorry to the company. I hope your business works out. There are plenty of suckers out their. I was one of them...

Thank you so much I know this is not intended to be used for medical purposes but during this covid pandemic believe it or not this product really helped my mom till she was able to get the proper medical device/machine to help her breath thank you so much.
Sent it out for someone to help breath while enduring with Covid

My wife bought this for me when I had Covid-19. She wanted to make sure if somehow for some reason my oxygen level is too low I have this at home to breath. I ended up not using it at all and my mom did. My mom got Covid-19 and she was not feeling well; she was sleepy and tried. I asked my wife bring her the oxygen meter and the oxygen bottles. Her oxygen level was at 88%! I immediately called them to use the oxygen while I was driving to their house to pick her up for ER visit. By the time I arrived, her oxygen level was at 95% and she was feeling better. She had to stay in the hospital for a whole week and used the oxygen tube for a few weeks before recovering. I knew a guy who had the same symptoms and same level of oxygen as my mom but 10 years younger. He didn't make it to the hospital and died in his sleep. I would recommend getting a couple of these at home just in case, especially during this pandemic.  Good luck and stay healthy everyone!
I like the ease of use and my ability to breathe easier with the oxygen.

I am so grateful that God put it in my mind to buy this. I CAN BREATHE AGAIN

To preface...I got COVID and it set up COVID pneumonia in my lungs. I spent 3 weeks in ICU and nearly died. The Boost cans gave me the means of doing just that, and still being able to take a few puffs to recover when I would get winded. In what was a very difficult time for me, these were a Godsend.

oxygen.review: First used this oxygen during 4 days of skiing at Vail.  At 8300 ft elevation, I was short of breath and suffered for 2 days from altitude sickness.  This oxygen helped me overcome the altitude issues and enjoy my skiing up to 10,500 ft.
Love using this boost oxygen, but beware of the 5Liter, these are the SMALL cans.  22OZ is the large can.
I like it but does not have as much oxygen as it claims to.

I live in the Southwest at about 1000 ft elevation. We frequently take road trips to Colorado where our kids and grandkids live, and visit National Parks and Monuments along the way, including those in Colorado & Utah; some at elevations of 8000+ ft. This poses a challenge for me, as I have COPD. I've used Boost Oxygen for some time, and ordered these "medium size" cans as they are easier to carry than the full 6 litre size. I feel much more comfortable taking short hikes knowing this provides a quick shot of oxygen when/if needed. The effects are, of course, short term, but noticeably helpful for me..enough to help "catch" my breath. BE AWARE: Many airlines do not allow these canisters in carry-on or checked baggage.Check with your airline. If I'm flying to a location where I feel I'll need this product, I ship ahead via UPS. A special DOT label is required.
I'm on the fence about these, if they were cheaper I'd buy more but their oxygen is to steep for my blood

essentially buying an expensive aluminum bottle that may or may not contain Oxygen.  Best that I can tell it has minimal compression and certainly not compressed enough for liquid oxygen so out of pressure quickly.  you pay for very slow delivery also. bought it to see what it was but would not recommend nor would I reorder.........

Despite the label saying that oxygen is weightless - compressed gas will add weight to any canister so when these arrived weighing about the same as an empty can, I did a few experiments. 1. the candle/jar test -  No change in flame size, color 2. oximeter test - No change after inhaling to oxygen uptake levels 3. weight of can empty and "supposedly full"  - barely negligible 4. 100, 1 second inhales.  Got  as far as 25 over 2 days and then empty 5. the somewhat subjective "feeling test" NO difference.  I've experienced a distinct difference in oxygen bars. 6. emailed manufacturer based on comments here, no response in 6 days. I'm beginning to think this is a potential large scale snake oil type scam!

I was skeptical at first since cans arrive very light weight and seem almost like they are empty. But this is not the case they are very full and pressurized. I wanted to test the results with actual measurements of oxygen level content so I took before and after readings with a pulse oximeter. My oxygen level usually hovers around 94-95% due to health conditions. After 5 deep breaths with the canister my oxygen level immediately went up to 99-100%. It also stayed elevated for 30+ minutes. This product works and makes you feel more alert. My vision also appeared to be clearer when looking at my computer monitors. Its amazing what an Oxygen boost can do for you.
